intro: Dichapetalum librevillense, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, wind-dispersed seeds.
